entry.title: Entry #1171 in The New York Times Company v. Microsoft Corporation, 1:23-cv-11195
entry.summary: ORDER : OpenAI's objection (Dkt. No. 638) pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 72(a) to Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang's September 19, 2025 Order (Dkt. No. 604) is dismissed as moot in light of the parties' resolution of this dispute. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Sidney H. Stein on 1/27/2026) Filed In Associated Cases: 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW, 1:23-cv-11195-SHS-OTW (jca) (Entered: 01/27/2026)

entry.summary: ORDER re: (1182 in 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW) Letter, filed by OpenAI. The deadline to produce the two memoranda and deposition transcript referenced in ECF 1182 is EXTENDED to 6:00 PM EST on Tuesday, January 27, 2026. If OpenAI is able to facilitate production of these documents before then, they are encouraged to do so. (HEREBY ORDERED by Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang) (Text Only Order) Filed In Associated Cases: 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW et al. (Entered: 01/26/2026)

entry.title: Entry #1168 in The New York Times Company v. Microsoft Corporation, 1:23-cv-11195
entry.summary: ORDER re: (1178 in 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW) Letter, filed by The New York Times Company. If OpenAI objects to the production as described in the last paragraph of ECF 1178, it shall file its objection by 11:59pm Eastern time TONIGHT. If no objection is filed, the production shall be made by 6:00pm Eastern on Monday, January 26. The production may also be made at any time before Monday at noon if OpenAI does not object. (HEREBY ORDERED by Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang) (Text Only Order) Filed In Associated Cases: 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW et al. (Wang, Ona) (Entered: 01/23/2026)

entry.title: Entry #1167 in The New York Times Company v. Microsoft Corporation, 1:23-cv-11195
entry.summary: NOTICE OF FILING OF OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT Notice is hereby given that an official transcript of a CONFERENCE proceeding held on 1/15/2026 has been filed by the court reporter/transcriber in the above-captioned matter. The parties have seven (7) calendar days to file with the court a Notice of Intent to Request Redaction of this transcript. If no such Notice is filed, the transcript may be made remotely electronically available to the public without redaction after 90 calendar days...Filed In Associated Cases: 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW et al..(Moya, Goretti) (Entered: 01/23/2026)

entry.title: Entry #1162 in The New York Times Company v. Microsoft Corporation, 1:23-cv-11195
entry.summary: ORDER: The Court held a discovery status conference for all actions in this matter on Thursday, January 15, 2026. As ORDERED at the January 15 Conference: The Court held a discovery status conference for all actions in this matter on Thursday, January 15, 2026. As ORDERED at the January 15 Conference: News Plaintiffs' motion to compel Microsoft's production of output log data (ECF 1014) is DENIED as premature. The parties are directed to continue meeting and conferring and to provide an update in the January 22, 2026, joint status letter. OpenAI's motion for the Times's profit-and-loss statements (ECF Nos. 1028, 1032) is DENIED. News Plaintiffs' motion to compel OpenAI's production of output log data (ECF 1061) is GRANTED in part. OpenAI is directed to amend their PII redactions and re-produce the sample by January 22, 2026. OpenAI's motion for a protective order regarding Greg Brockman's deposition is DENIED. (ECF 1041). The deposition will be capped at 11 hours, however, Mr. Brockmanmay elect whether his deposition will occur over a one- or two-day period and further set forth in this Order. The parties' briefing schedule for the February 11, 2026, discovery status conference is as follows: i. Opening briefs are due by Friday, January 30, 2026; ii. Opposing briefs are due by Wednesday, February 4, 2026; and iii. The parties' joint dispute chart is due by Thursday, February 5, 2026. The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to close the following ECF Nos. in Case No. 25-MD-3143: 1014, 1023, 1028, 1034, 1037, 1041, 1043, 1050, 1051, 1052, 1053, 1054, 1056, 1057, 1058, 1059, 1061, 1066, 1070, 1073, 1074. Motions terminated: (1082 in 1:23-cv-11195-SHS-OTW, 1014 in 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW) LETTER MOTION to Compel Microsoft Corp. to produce immediately, in a readily searchable remotely-accessible format, the approximately 8.1 million consumer Copilot (f/k/a Bing Chat) output logs addressed to Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang fro filed by The New York Times Company, DP Media Network, LLC, Northwest Publications, LLC, ORB Publishing, LLC, San Jose Mercury-News, LLC, Orlando Sentinel Communications Company, LLC, Sun-sentinel Company, LLC, Daily News LP, Chicago Tribune Company, LLC, (1037 in 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW, 874 in 1:23-cv-08292-SHS-OTW) LETTER MOTION to Compel The Authors Guild to produce five clawed back documents addressed to Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang from Katie Lynn Joyce, Allison S. Blanco, Caitlin Sinclaire Blythe dated January 5, 2026. filed by OpenAI, Inc., OpenAI GP LLC, OpenAI Startup Fund GP I LLC, OAI Corporation LLC, OpenAI LP, OpenAI OpCo, L.L.C., OpenAI Startup Fund I LP, OpenAI GP, LLC, OpenAI Holdings LLC, OpenAI, Inc.
